Overview

Overview Erik Wilde (@dret): Introduction and Overview

(8) Grand Goal

  • Help you to formulate your own API strategy
  • Make sure we cover all the relevant areas
  • Focus on strategy instead of status quo or program
  • Manage the strategy as a living document
  • Use the strategy as foundation for program and investments


Overview Erik Wilde (@dret): Introduction and Overview

(9) Grand Plan

  • Initial information/synchronization
  • Working through the CAM compass model
  • Structured discussion around the compass elements
  • Strategy draft derived from structured discussions
  • Final discussion for feedback and prioritization


Overview Erik Wilde (@dret): Introduction and Overview

(10) Schedule

  • Day 1, Session 1 (10.00-12.00): Introduction and API strategy presentations
  • Day 1, Session 2 (14.00-18.00): Discussion tech and biz pillars, external perspective
  • Day 2, Session 1 (10.00-12.00): Discussion org pillar, external perspective
  • Day 2, Session 2 (14.00-18.00): Discussion biz and org and tech pillars, internal perspective
  • Day 3, Session 1 (14.00-16.00): Discussion draft strategy and final prioritization


Terminology

Terminology Erik Wilde (@dret): Introduction and Overview

(12) Application Programming Interface (API)

  • A network-enabled way to interact with the representation of a capability
  • No assumptions about specific interaction styles or interconnection technologies
  • Loose coupling increases implementation-independence


Terminology Erik Wilde (@dret): Introduction and Overview

(13) API Strategy

  • APIs as the boundaries within and between business processes
  • Re-imagining the business as a set of API-interconnected capabilities
  • Why/where does it make sense to use APIs as the business glue
  • What is necessary to improve organizational fitness?


Terminology Erik Wilde (@dret): Introduction and Overview

(14) API Program

  • How to put the strategy into action to improve organizational fitness?
  • Starting small and building up iteratively
  • Focusing on constraints (what to do) instead of rules (how to do it)
  • Feedback and enablement as key components of a shared API practice


Terminology Erik Wilde (@dret): Introduction and Overview

(15) API Management

  • Managing APIs and API products as core assets of an organization
  • Technical management is about managing access to the API
  • Lifecycle management is about managing the product lifecycle
  • Landscape management addresses all relevant APIs for an organization


Terminology Erik Wilde (@dret): Introduction and Overview

(16) API Landscape

  • The set of all APIs that an organization needs to function
  • The landscape also includes APIs that are consumed by the organization
  • The landscape is decentralized and diverse
  • The landscape is dynamic and evolving


Terminology Erik Wilde (@dret): Introduction and Overview

(17) API Platform

  • Anything that allows teams to contribute to the API landscape
  • APIs (internal and external) are part of the API platform
  • Design/implementation/runtime tools are part of the API platform
  • Organizational support is part of the API platform

(25) API Challenges

  • Challenges from the business perspective
    • Balance risk/cost and necessary investments in business agility
    • Start making API thinking (i.e., agility) part of business culture
  • Challenges from the organizational perspective
    • Enable and empower teams by reducing command-and-control structures
    • Start building feedback structures for observing/supporting teams
  • Challenges from the technology perspective
    • Enable and empower developers to adjust to the ecosystem approach
    • Move architecture from "how" to "what" and practice loose coupling
